document.docAuthor: Binoy, C., Kumar, P. Girish & Santhosh, S.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of Indian Dasyproctus Lepeletier & Brullé 1835 (Hymenoptera Crabronidae) with description of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Indian Dasyproctus Lepeletier & Brullé 1835 (Hymenoptera Crabronidae) with description of four new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dasyproctus buddha : Leclercq, 1956: 147
;
1972: 104
, 105, 109, 113.
Tsuneki, 1974: 644
( Thailand ; variation).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Clypeus apico-medially bevelled, truncated or slightly emarginated; anterior carina of pronotal collar bending towards insertion of fore coxa; IOC distinct; POD equal to OOD; punctuation on head and mesosoma not very marked, obsolete punctures beyond lateral ocelli; Gt 1 and Gt 2 immaculate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–32.
Dasyproctus buddha (Cameron)
♀. 25. Habitus, lateral view; 26. Head, dorsal view; 27. Head, frontal view; 28. Clypeus; 29. Mesosoma , dorsal view; 30. Mesosoma , lateral view; 31. Gt 1 & Gt 2 , dorsal view; 32. Metasoma, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Female . Body length 12.17–13.24 mm ; fore wing length 8.33–8.6 mm .

Clypeus apico-medially bevelled, truncated or slightly emarginated ( Fig. 28 ); IOC distinct; POD equal to OOD ( Fig. 26 ); anterior bordering carina of pronotal collar bending towards insertion of fore coxa; Gt 1 pedunculate; black with following parts variously coloured: scape yellow; mandible yellow with apex reddish; pronotal collar, except on medial notch and pronotal lobe yellow; prepectus dorsal third yellow; axilla and scutellum anteriorly yellow ( Fig. 29 ); fore and mid femora brown with ventral and apical yellow patch, fore and mid tibiae yellow with inner part brown; hind femur brown; hind tibia yellow with uneven brown patches; Gt 1 and Gt 2 immaculate ( Fig. 31 ); Gt 3 –Gt 5 with markedly smaller patches laterally ( Fig. 32 ).

Male
. Unknown. For details, see male of
Dasyproctus idrieus (Cameron)
.
Distribution. India : Andhra Pradesh , Assam , Kerala , Rajasthan , Uttarakhand , Tamil Nadu .

Note. Since the male of
Crabro idrieus Cameron
no longer falls within the limits of
D. buddha (Cameron)
, the authors feel it judicious to treat the male of
D. buddha
as unknown. Collection details of the present study only are included here.
